channel.title: Metals Industry News Feed
channel.description: Automated news feed for aluminum, steel, copper, and nickel industries

item.title: Rio Tinto advances Nuton copper processing technology at Johnson Camp mine
item.description: Rio Tinto achieved a milestone with the first copper produced using Nuton technology, which uses bioleaching to extract copper directly at the mine, bypassing traditional smelting and refining. Nuton can recover up to 85% from primary sulphides, extend mine life, and reduce environmental impact with a projected carbon footprint of 0.82 kg CO₂-e/kg copper and water usage of 71 liters/kg copper.

item.title: Chile, Peru, Brazil and Argentina Look to the Copper Boom with Optimism
item.description: Latin American countries are optimistic about copper's role in clean technologies and the energy transition, with copper being essential for solar panels, wind turbines, and electrical grids. New copper projects in the region emphasize ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) principles to ensure sustainability and minimize environmental and social impacts, aligning with carbon market requirements.

item.title: Nickel prices were in the doldrums this week, with domestic inventory increasing slightly
item.description: Nickel prices showed sideways movement this week, oscillating between $14,700/mt and $14,900/mt on the LME and SHFE markets. Despite weak demand and sluggish trading, expectations of a US Fed interest rate cut and progress in geopolitical conflicts provided some support, while LME nickel inventory remained high at over 250,000 mt.

item.title: Breakthrough Tech Yields 99% Pure Nickel, Cobalt
item.description: A research team at UNIST developed an innovative electrochemical recycling technology that recovers over 95% of nickel and cobalt from waste batteries with purity exceeding 99%. This sustainable method reduces chemical use and wastewater generation, potentially transforming the battery recycling industry by enabling a more efficient and environmentally friendly recovery process.

item.title: Critical metals innovator pH7 raises $25.6M
item.description: pH7 has raised $25.6 million to advance its closed-loop organo-electrochemical extraction technology that recovers metals like nickel from lower-grade ores and uneconomic feedstocks. The process reduces energy consumption and wastewater generation, supporting resilient domestic supply chains and sustainable metal recovery for the energy transition.

item.title: Unilever, Ball and Alcoa unveil “first” carbon-free aluminum aerosol can
item.description: Ball Corporation, Unilever, and Alcoa introduced the first aerosol can made using Elysis carbon-free smelting technology, combining 50% Elysis aluminum with 50% recycled content. This innovation eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions from smelting by producing oxygen instead of CO2, marking a significant step in decarbonizing aluminum packaging for personal care products.

item.title: Aluminum Recycling Market to Reach US$91.3 Billion by 2032 as Global Demand for Low-Carbon Metals & Circular Manufacturing Surges
item.description: The aluminum recycling industry is rapidly evolving with technological innovations such as hydrogen-powered remelting furnaces and AI-guided scrap sorting systems to reduce carbon emissions and increase efficiency. Recycling aluminum uses 95% less energy than primary production, supporting circular economy principles and meeting growing demand, especially in electric vehicles requiring high aluminum content.

item.title: LME nickel price rises for 2 consecutive days due to falling US dollar
item.description: LME nickel futures rose by US$290 on December 7, closing at US$16,508/ton, while the spot price increased by US$291.5 to US$16,306/ton. The price rise is attributed to the falling US dollar, supporting nickel prices.

item.title: LME's nickel price soars on Dec 7 on crisis concerns & Indonesia's policy
item.description: The LME nickel price surged by US$2,170/ton on December 7, closing at US$31,441/ton amid crisis concerns and policy developments in Indonesia affecting the nickel market. The nickel spot price also saw a significant increase.

item.title: Aluminum price falls to one-month low in wider commodity slump
item.description: Aluminum prices dropped to a one-month low of $2,526 per ton on the London Metal Exchange amid a broader commodity slump. The decline follows stronger US retail sales data and anticipation of the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision. Despite short-term weakness, Commerzbank forecasts aluminum prices to rise to $2,800 a ton in the second half of 2025 due to expected production slowdowns and emission reduction requirements in China.

item.title: LME aluminium rises to USD 2,865/t and the inventories dip
item.description: London Metal Exchange aluminum prices increased to $2,865 per tonne, with inventories showing a decline. Alumina prices slightly decreased by 0.4% to $312.26 per tonne. The market reflects ongoing supply tightening amid fluctuating demand.

item.title: Steel plant to be built in Uganda with $500 million investment
item.description: A new steel plant is planned for construction in Uganda with an investment of $500 million, signaling expansion in steel production capacity in Africa. This development is part of broader global steel market activities including production changes and trade adjustments in various countries.

item.title: Launch of the Clean Steel Partnership paves the way for further research and deployment of groundbreaking technology
item.description: The Clean Steel Partnership aims to pilot and demonstrate breakthrough technologies to reduce CO2 emissions in the EU steel sector, targeting a 50% cut by 2027 compared to 1990 levels and achieving technology readiness level 8 by 2030. With an EU contribution of €700 million and private commitments up to €1 billion, the partnership supports the European Green Deal and the steel industry's transition to carbon neutrality by 2050.

item.title: AI Startup Deep.Meta Pushes UK Steel Toward Lower Emissions
item.description: Deep.Meta's AI-driven simulations have achieved nearly a 10% emissions reduction at Spartan UK's steel plate production facility. The company is advancing its Deep.Optimiser PhyX system with support from the UK government's Manchester Prize, aiming to enhance energy efficiency and support net zero goals in the steel industry through AI-assisted optimization.

item.title: Molten Industries Leads Strategic Partnership with U. S. Steel and CPFD Software to Pioneer Carbon-Neutral Steel Production
item.description: Molten Industries, U.S. Steel, and CPFD Software received a $5.4 million DOE grant to develop a project integrating methane-pyrolysis-driven hydrogen production with a pilot direct reduced iron furnace. This initiative aims to significantly reduce energy use, carbon intensity, and costs in steel production, potentially eliminating up to 60 million tons of CO2 emissions in U.S. steelmaking.

item.title: Column: Will the real Doctor Copper please step forward?
item.description: Copper prices are surging with record highs on London and Shanghai markets amid a complex market fracture rather than a simple supply crunch. LME copper stocks have been heavily drawn down, likely destined for the US due to import tariff threats, causing a split between US and global markets. Producers like Codelco have raised premiums significantly, reflecting tightness in supply and shifting inventory dynamics.

item.title: True North tops up the coffers to back growth programs
item.description: True North Copper is raising $12.5 million to accelerate development at its Mount Oxide project and the emerging Aquila discovery, supporting growth in copper production capacity.

item.title: Copper industry seeks curb on cheap imports
item.description: With India's copper production reaching new heights, local manufacturers are urging the government to restrict cheap imports to protect domestic capacity and market stability.

item.title: Global Copper Supply Crunch Threatens Market Stability in 2025
item.description: The global copper supply crunch is causing market fragmentation, driving record premiums, and reshaping investment strategies as supply tightness intensifies worldwide.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Fluctuate Rangebound on December 8, Central Bank Increases Gold Holdings for 13th Consecutive Month
item.description: Nickel prices remained rangebound with minor fluctuations on December 8, reflecting cautious market sentiment. The report also notes China's central bank increased gold reserves for the 13th consecutive month, indicating ongoing strategic commodity positioning.

item.title: PE eyes BHP's Nickel West as China tightens rare earth grip
item.description: Private equity investors are showing renewed interest in BHP's Nickel West amid China's tightening control over rare earth exports and nickel production. Nickel prices have dropped 50% over three years due to increased low-cost Indonesian production, much under Chinese ownership. Strategic moves by Japanese firms and U.S. investors aim to diversify supply chains and capitalize on nickel's growing role in electric vehicle batteries.

item.title: SPC Nickel sets clear 2026 exploration strategy
item.description: SPC Nickel is advancing its 2026 exploration plans following promising 2025 field results at the Muskox Project in Canada. The company is analyzing geophysics data and continuing drilling at Muskox and Lockerby East projects, targeting nickel, copper, and platinum group metals. Recent samples show high copper equivalents, indicating strong mineralization over large areas, supporting the company’s optimistic outlook.

item.title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal Expands Pipe Coating Business
item.description: Tenaris has acquired the oil and gas division of isOplus for $10 million, gaining ownership of pre-insulated pipeline systems for district heating and anti-corrosion coatings in Europe. The acquired business unit has been rebranded as Tenaris Coating Italy, enhancing Tenaris's capabilities in offshore markets and allowing anti-corrosion coatings to be applied at its facilities in Italy and other countries.

item.title: Prysmian Group invests €350 million in new cable-laying vessels and expands submarine cable production capacity
item.description: Prysmian Group announced a €350 million investment to add two advanced cable-laying vessels to its fleet, enhancing its submarine project execution capabilities. The company is also expanding production capacity at its plants in Finland and Italy, including a €100 million investment in the Arco Felice plant in Italy, to meet growing demand for submarine cables driven by energy transition and grid upgrades.

item.title: SMM: Secondary Aluminum Ingot Social Inventory Drops on Dec 8
item.description: According to SMM statistics, the release of production from new aluminum capacity is delayed, resulting in limited production growth in December. Secondary aluminum ingot social inventory has dropped, reflecting tighter supply conditions in the market.

item.title: Iron Ore Prices Dip Amid China Slowdown
item.description: Iron ore prices declined last week due to a seasonal slowdown in China's steel sector and rising supply pressure. Capacity utilization rates and daily hot metal production decreased, while shipments from Australia increased, leading to higher inventory levels at Chinese ports and downward pressure on steel market sentiment.

item.title: HRC Steel Hits 15-week High
item.description: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) steel prices increased to $857 per tonne, the highest since July 2025, marking a 5.28% gain over the past four weeks and a 23.69% rise over the last 12 months. This reflects a strengthening trend in steel prices despite some recent volatility.

item.title: China's Steel Surplus Isn't Easy to Tackle, Says Association
item.description: The World Steel Association highlighted the difficulty in addressing China's steel overcapacity due to its deep integration with the domestic economy. The association forecasts a 2% decline in Chinese steel demand in 2025 and another 1% in 2026, with no short-term practical solutions to the surplus problem.

item.title: JSW Steel Share Price Live Updates
item.description: JSW Steel's share price showed a consistent trading pattern, closing at Rs 1162.2 in the previous trading session. This reflects stable investor sentiment amid ongoing market developments in the steel sector.

item.title: China's Steel Surplus Isn't Easy to Tackle, Says Association
item.description: The World Steel Association highlighted that China's steel overcapacity is deeply embedded in its economy, making it difficult to resolve quickly. Closing steel companies has significant ripple effects on the domestic economy, and there is no short-term practical solution to the surplus. This underscores the complexity of addressing global steel production imbalances.

item.title: New Australia–China agreement launches joint steel decarbonisation effort
item.description: Australia and China have signed a memorandum of understanding to support ongoing discussions aimed at reducing emissions across the iron and steel value chains. The initiative focuses on pathways to lower-emissions steel production, evolving markets for decarbonised steel, and policy cooperation, recognizing steel and ironmaking contribute up to 9% of global emissions.

item.title: Copper trades near record as US stockpiling spurs supply crunch
item.description: Copper prices are near all-time highs driven by US stockpiling and tight global supply, fueling investor bets on a sustained rally. The market is characterized by a supply-demand imbalance and a global shortage of raw materials, contributing to the price surge.

item.title: Copper Prices Surge to Record High
item.description: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange reached a record high of $11,705 a tonne, closing 1.5% higher at $11,620.50. The surge is driven by bullish forecasts from Citi analysts who expect a shortage due to increased US stockpiling and anticipate copper averaging $13,000 a tonne in Q2 2026. The rally is supported by rising global consumption and concerns over metal inventory depletion outside the US.

item.title: Copper Trades Near Record as US Stockpiling Spurs Supply Crunch
item.description: Copper traded near an all-time high after hitting a record $11,705 a ton, with momentum fueled by Citigroup analysts' bullish outlook. The market faces a supply-demand imbalance and global raw material shortages, intensified by US stockpiling efforts.

item.title: The Monday Report - 08 December 2025
item.description: Nickel prices showed a slight increase, rising 0.27% to $6.68 per pound as part of a broader rise in base metals including copper and aluminum. The report highlights ongoing market movements and commodity price trends over the past week, with nickel maintaining modest gains despite broader market volatility.

item.title: Market Watch: Monday 8th December, 2025
item.description: The pre-feasibility study for the Gonneville palladium-nickel-copper deposit in Western Australia, owned by Chalice Mining, indicates a capital requirement of $820 million for development. The project has a post-tax net present value of $1 billion, highlighting significant investment interest in nickel-related assets in the region.

item.title: Trump's Tariffs Send U.S. Aluminum Prices to Record Highs
item.description: U.S. aluminum prices reached a record $4,816 per ton due to sharply tightened domestic inventories caused by tariffs imposed by the Trump administration. The tariffs, which doubled to 50%, have reduced imports from Canada and contributed to shrinking U.S. aluminum inventory, pushing prices higher amid strong demand and supply constraints.

item.title: Aluminum premium reaches record high in the US due to tariffs and global squeeze
item.description: The U.S. aluminum premium hit a record high, with buyers paying $4,792 per ton when the base price is $2,850, driven by tariffs and global supply reductions including Chinese mine disruptions and smelter output cuts. The Midwest premium rose to 88.10 cents per pound, reflecting increased costs from duties and supply tightness.

item.title: US Aluminum Prices Surge Above Those in Overseas Markets
item.description: U.S. aluminum prices have surged above international levels, driven by tariffs and supply constraints, causing a record-high premium for the lightweight metal in the U.S. market. This price divergence reflects the impact of trade policies and domestic supply-demand imbalances.

item.title: Aluminum Prices Rebound from One-Month Low Amid Supply Constraints and Production Challenges
item.description: Aluminum futures rebounded above $2,850 per tonne after hitting a near one-month low, supported by macroeconomic tailwinds and supply disruptions including equipment failure at Iceland’s Grundartangi smelter. China plans to curb overcapacity with a production cap of 45 million tons annually and faces setbacks in building smelters in Indonesia due to energy costs and regulatory hurdles.

item.title: Aluminum's Impact on Sustainable Development Goals
item.description: This article discusses how aluminum drives sustainable development through innovations in recycling, energy efficiency, and economic growth. It highlights technology priorities such as improving recycling efficiency, reducing processing costs, and expanding recycled aluminum applications, especially in electric vehicles and construction. The piece also explores market projections through 2030, emphasizing investment opportunities in recycling infrastructure, renewable energy integration, and supply chain optimization.

item.title: HRC Steel Price Trends and Forecasts
item.description: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel traded flat at 908 USD/T on December 8, 2025, showing a 6.70% rise over the past month and a 34.52% increase compared to the same time last year. The price is expected to reach 914.08 USD/T by the end of the quarter and 998.71 USD/T within 12 months, reflecting positive market momentum despite recent fluctuations.

item.title: Cleveland-Cliffs and Carmakers Embrace Multi-Year, Fixed-Price Contracts
item.description: Cleveland-Cliffs is ending slab supply to ArcelorMittal Calvert and shifting toward multi-year, fixed-price steel contracts with automotive manufacturers to provide supply and cost certainty amid current trade and tariff environments. The company anticipates a U.S. automotive production resurgence, preparing to increase steel supply significantly despite weaker vehicle sales.

item.title: JSW Steel records 5% growth in crude steel production
item.description: JSW Steel reported a 5% year-over-year increase in consolidated crude steel production for November 2025, reaching 24.39 lakh tonnes. Capacity utilization of Indian operations was at 84%, impacted by the shutdown of Blast Furnace 3 at Vijayanagar for capacity upgradation from 3 to 4.5 MTPA.

item.title: U.S. Steel to restart steel production at Illinois plant
item.description: U.S. Steel announced it will restart steelmaking at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois after a two-year idle period, citing rising customer demand and an improved steel market. The company plans to resume production in the first half of 2026 after hiring and training workers and preparing equipment.

item.title: Green Innovations: Increasing uptake of sustainable practices in road construction
item.description: The article highlights growing adoption of sustainable practices in road construction, including the use of steel slag and blast furnace slag as by-products of the steel industry. ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India secured a technology licence in July 2025 to convert steel slag into engineered road aggregates, with roads built using these materials estimated to be 40% more cost-effective and three times more durable than conventional pavements.

item.title: Copper price climbs to fresh high on China outlook boost
item.description: Copper futures on the London Metal Exchange rose as much as 1.3% to $11,771/ton, surpassing previous all-time highs. The rally is driven by China's commitment to domestic growth and proactive fiscal policies for 2026, boosting demand prospects. Supply concerns persist due to US stockpiling and global mine outages, with analysts forecasting a global refined copper shortfall of 450,000 tons next year.

item.title: Copper price climbs to fresh high on China outlook boost
item.description: Copper prices reached new highs, climbing to $11,771 per ton on the LME, driven by US stockpiling and China's commitment to domestic growth in 2026. Analysts expect a global refined copper shortfall of 450,000 tons next year, with prices needing to average above $12,000 per ton to attract new mining investments. Demand is supported by sectors like data centers and electric vehicles, while supply is constrained by mine outages worldwide.

item.title: Rewiring Sustainable, Clean Energy Future With Copper
item.description: Copper plays a crucial role in the global clean energy transition due to its high recyclability and superior electrical and thermal conductivity. The International Energy Agency projects copper demand for clean energy could nearly double by 2050, driven by electrification and renewable power expansion. Innovations in recycling and sustainable mining practices are key to ensuring copper supports a net-zero future with minimal environmental impact.

item.title: Gunnison Copper Announces That Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology Produces First Copper
item.description: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology has achieved a breakthrough in copper production by producing copper with up to 80% less water usage and 60% lower carbon emissions compared to conventional methods. The technology shortens supply chains by producing copper cathode directly at the mine and extends mine life by extracting value from waste materials. Nuton aims to deliver the lowest carbon footprint copper in the U.S., supporting cleaner domestic supply chains.

item.title: Rio Tinto's Nuton tech makes first-ever copper cathode at Gunnison mine
item.description: Nuton technology by Rio Tinto has produced its first copper cathode at the Gunnison mine, demonstrating cleaner, faster, and more efficient copper production at an industrial scale. The technology reduces water use by up to 80% and carbon emissions by up to 60%, while eliminating milling and refining steps. This innovation supports the production of low-carbon copper and strengthens the U.S. supply chain for sustainable copper.

item.title: Nornickel fully restores cobalt production after repairs from 2022 fire
item.description: Norilsk Nickel has completed reconstruction of its cobalt production facility in the Murmansk region, damaged by a fire in 2022. The upgraded plant will increase cobalt production capacity from 1,000 to 3,000 tons per year, making it the only cobalt producer in Russia with high-purity output.

item.title: Norilsk Nickel resumed cobalt production in Monchegorsk
item.description: Norilsk Nickel resumed cobalt production at the Kola Mining and Processing Plant after reconstruction, investing 5.3 billion rubles. The plant produces up to 3,000 tons per year of 99.9% pure metallic cobalt, used in batteries, catalysts, magnets, and aerospace.

item.title: Tartisan Nickel starts drilling at Kenbridge project in Ontario
item.description: Tartisan Nickel Corp. has commenced drilling at its 100%-owned Kenbridge Nickel-Copper-Cobalt Project in Northwestern Ontario. The drilling program aims to convert resources, test extensions of high-grade zones, and collect data for engineering and development studies.

item.title: NOVONIX’s patented, all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology
item.description: NOVONIX has developed a patented, all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology that significantly reduces costs and environmental impact in nickel-based cathode production. This innovation supports sustainability throughout the nickel battery value chain, from mining to end-of-life recycling.

item.title: Reinventing America's critical minerals supply chain
item.description: The US Department of Energy announced $1 billion in funding for initiatives including nickel to enhance domestic supply chains. The focus is on innovative refining techniques, recycling, and energy-efficient processes to support sustainable and secure nickel production critical for clean energy technologies.

item.title: Recycling legends trace past to guide e-scrap future
item.description: Industry pioneers discussed the evolution of electronics recycling policies, highlighting early laws requiring manufacturers to recycle nickel cadmium batteries. This history informs current efforts to improve lithium-ion battery recycling and sustainability in nickel usage.

item.title: Tenaris buys Penn. shredder from SA Recycling
item.description: US steelmaker Tenaris has acquired SA Recycling's shredder and processing yard in Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania. This acquisition allows Tenaris to gain greater control over its scrap supply stream and integrate steel production with scrap processing to streamline production.

item.title: Tenaris remains profitable in 2025
item.description: Tenaris reported a $37 million profit in Q3 2025, a 15.6% increase from the previous quarter but down 22.9% from Q3 2024. Sales in the North American oil and gas tube market remained steady, with resilient drilling activity despite some recent reductions in the US, Canada, and Saudi Arabia. The company expects sales to remain stable but margins will be affected by increased tariff costs.

item.title: Tenaris S.A. Announces Share Buyback Program of Up to USD 1.2 Billion
item.description: Tenaris announced a $1.2 billion share buyback program starting June 9, 2025, with the first tranche covering up to $600 million ending December 8, 2025. The shares acquired will be canceled over time, reflecting management's confidence amid oil and gas market conditions.

item.title: Tenaris reduced pipe sales to 2.95 million tons in January-September
item.description: Tenaris sold 2.95 million tons of pipe products in the first nine months of 2025, a 2% decrease compared to the same period in 2024. This reflects a slight decline in demand or production during this timeframe.

item.title: AISI: Raw steel production eases to near multi-month low
item.description: U.S. raw steel production slightly declined to 1,734,000 short tons in the week ending December 6, marking the second-lowest weekly production since May. Despite the recent dip, year-to-date production is up 3.3% compared to last year, with a mill capability utilization rate of 75.7%. Regional production varied, with increases in the Northeast, Midwest, and West, and decreases in the Great Lakes and South regions.

item.title: Brazil steel quotas fill ahead of AD ruling
item.description: Brazilian steel importers are filling quotas for cold-rolled coil and coated steel ahead of an anti-dumping ruling. The report also highlights a decline in Mexican steel production and consumption year-to-date October, with production down 9% amid a demand glut. The most produced and consumed steel products include rebar, hot-rolled coil, and galvanized steel.

item.title: LME aluminium cash offer rises to $2,867.5/t as opening stocks fall 0.47% to 525,800t
item.description: The London Metal Exchange (LME) aluminum cash offer increased to $2,867.5 per tonne amid a 0.47% decline in opening stocks to 525,800 tonnes, indicating tightening supply conditions in the aluminum market.

item.title: Secondary Aluminum Alloy Ingot Social Inventory Drops on December 9
item.description: Short-term aluminum price fluctuations have intensified, suppressing downstream procurement pace, with some die-casting enterprises facing challenges. The release of production from new aluminum capacity is expected to take some time, resulting in limited production growth in December.

item.title: BHP shares take centre stage as Citi tips record-breaking copper price to storm even higher
item.description: Copper prices reached a fresh all-time high above US$11,770 per tonne on the London Metal Exchange, gaining over 30% this year. Citi analysts project copper prices to average US$13,000 per tonne in Q2 2026, driven by a lower interest-rate environment, fiscal expansion in the US, European demand, and the global energy transition. This outlook is positive for BHP shares, a major copper producer.

item.title: Peru Extends Dispute License Period, LME Copper Fluctuated Overnight and Closed Higher
item.description: LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, closing slightly higher at $11,675/mt amid tight supply and weak downstream demand. Inventory changes showed a slight increase in LME copper cathode stocks and a decrease in SHFE warrant inventory. Imported copper prices saw minor changes, while domestic arrivals remained normal, indicating ongoing market volatility.

item.title: BHP shares take centre stage as Citi tips record-breaking copper price to storm even higher
item.description: Copper prices hit a fresh all-time high above $11,770 per ton on the LME, with Citigroup forecasting prices to average $13,000 per ton in Q2 2026 due to strong demand from energy transition technologies and AI data centers. BHP, now the world's largest copper miner, is expanding output with a $840 million investment in South Australian projects, benefiting from the bullish copper market outlook.

item.title: True North grows Mt Oxide with funding
item.description: True North Copper is raising $12.5 million to accelerate drilling and growth activities at its Mt Oxide Project in 2026, aiming to expand copper production capacity.

item.title: Nickel market set to remain in surplus through 2026: ING
item.description: Global nickel supply is expected to exceed demand again in 2026, maintaining a market surplus. This outlook suggests continued pressure on nickel prices despite potential supply cuts.

item.title: World's first AlN-based high-frequency transistor for post-5G wireless communication
item.description: NTT achieved the world's first millimeter-wave power amplification using aluminum nitride (AlN)-based transistors with over 75% aluminum composition. This breakthrough supports the evolution of wireless communication infrastructure beyond 5G, promising expanded coverage and higher speeds with potential applications in power conversion and wireless communications.

item.title: HRC Steel fell to 906.08 USD/T on December 9, 2025, down 0.21% from the previous day
item.description: HRC Steel price decreased slightly to 906.08 USD/T on December 9, 2025, down 0.21% from the previous day. Over the past month, the price rose 6.47%, and it is up 34.23% compared to the same time last year. The price is expected to reach 914.08 USD/T by the end of the quarter and 998.71 USD/T in 12 months.

item.title: SMU Price Ranges: Coated and plate inch higher, other products stable
item.description: Steel prices for hot-rolled and cold-rolled coil held steady at multi-month highs, with hot-rolled coil at $895/st and cold-rolled coil at $1,070/st. Coated steel prices increased slightly, with galvanized steel reaching a six-month high of $1,035/st. Plate prices resumed rising, up $5/st to a near four-month high of $1,025/st. Price momentum indicates further increases are expected.

item.title: Tata Steel Secures Indo-Sweden Funding Under the Industry Transition Partnership for Two Decarbonisation Projects
item.description: Tata Steel has received funding under the Indo-Sweden Industry Transition Partnership to collaborate on two projects aimed at accelerating decarbonisation in the steel and cement sectors. These projects focus on pioneering disruptive technologies and improving resource efficiency, including recovering metallics from steel slag and converting waste into sustainable cement materials.

item.title: Copper Rallies on Supply-Squeeze Fears
item.description: Copper futures in the US climbed to around $5.4 per pound, hitting their highest levels in more than four months amid ongoing supply disruptions and a large withdrawal of metal from LME warehouses, fueling speculation of a supply squeeze. However, prices slipped slightly as investors weighed demand uncertainties from China, which is balancing stimulus with financial risk management.

item.title: Comex Copper Settles 2.31% Lower at $5.2405 — Data Talk
item.description: Front Month Comex Copper for December delivery dropped 2.31% to $5.2405, marking the largest one-day dollar decline since late October 2025. The price has fallen for two consecutive sessions amid profit-taking and market caution, though it remains up 31.47% year-to-date and 24.08% month-to-date.

item.title: Copper Prices Hold Steady As Fed Decision Looms
item.description: Copper prices are steady near record highs as investors await the US Federal Reserve's policy decision amid ongoing supply constraints and mine disruptions. While copper trades near historical peaks, other metals show mixed results across major exchanges. The market remains cautious ahead of potential interest rate changes, with supply challenges supporting price stability.

item.title: Copper Prices Dip Amid Economic Uncertainty
item.description: Copper prices declined due to trader caution ahead of the Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee meeting and economic uncertainty. Despite China's signals of a proactive fiscal approach, investor skepticism remains, with weakening demand indicators and record-low processing fees for copper rods putting downward pressure on prices.

item.title: Copper pressured by profit-taking ahead of Fed decision - Markets
item.description: Copper prices slipped on profit-taking following a strong rally, amid concerns about slower US interest rate hikes. The market is cautious ahead of the Federal Reserve's decision, which is influencing metal prices including copper.

item.title: Copper Prices Dip Amid Economic Uncertainty
item.description: Copper prices fell on December 9 due to trader caution ahead of the Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee meeting and skepticism about China's economic stimulus effectiveness. Despite China's proactive fiscal approach, weakening demand signs emerged, including difficulties for fabricators to pass on high copper costs and record-low processing fees for copper rods.

item.title: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology produces first copper
item.description: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology has achieved a breakthrough by producing copper with significantly reduced environmental impact, using up to 80% less water and 60% lower carbon emissions than conventional methods. The modular system integrates biology, chemistry, engineering, and digital tools to unlock resources from challenging ores, aiming for the lowest carbon footprint copper production in the U.S.

item.title: Copper for Tomorrow: Sustainable copper production
item.description: The Copper for Tomorrow bid focuses on increasing sustainable copper production by addressing challenges in the value chain, especially processing lower grade ores with less energy and water. This initiative aims to double copper production sustainably to meet the growing demand driven by the clean energy transition and help companies achieve environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals.

item.title: Nickel declines on negative price outlook for next year
item.description: Nickel prices fell as Goldman Sachs issued a downbeat forecast, expecting prices to drop 6% to $14,500 per metric ton by December 2026. The bank cited supply surplus and subdued demand factors, with spot nickel prices down 0.7% at $14,900 per ton as of the report.

item.title: Indonesia nickel matte production up 3.60% MoM in Nov
item.description: Indonesia's nickel matte production reached 36,900 tonnes in nickel content in November 2025, marking a 3.60% month-on-month increase and a 20.16% year-on-year rise. The cumulative production from January to November 2025 was 296,100 tonnes, down 7.79% compared to the same period last year. December production is projected to slightly increase to 37,100 tonnes, including both high-grade and low-grade nickel matte.

item.title: DUMONT NICKEL PROJECT EXPECTED TO DELIVER $1.1 BILLION ANNUALLY TO CANADA AND ADVANCE NATIONAL CRITICAL MINERALS GOALS
item.description: The Dumont Nickel Project in Québec is expected to generate $1.1 billion in annual real GDP for Canada, supporting thousands of skilled jobs and providing a secure nickel supply for North America and Europe. The project will increase Canadian nickel output by about 15%, bolstering battery and advanced materials supply chains, energy transition, and critical national-security industries such as defense and aerospace.

item.title: Vale Foresees Higher Iron Ore, Copper & Nickel Production Next Year
item.description: Vale projects a 10% increase in nickel production for 2026, targeting 170,000-200,000 tons, alongside a 3% rise in iron ore and copper output. The company aims to meet the higher end of its 2025 production guidance and plans capital investments of $5.4 to $5.7 billion in 2026. Vale is positioning itself to become the world's largest iron ore producer while expanding its nickel output.

item.title: Aviseo study reveals $1.1B GDP impact for Dumont Nickel
item.description: The Dumont Nickel Project in Quebec is expected to increase Canadian nickel output by approximately 15%, supporting battery supply chains and critical industries. The project will generate $1.9 billion in capital investment during construction phases from 2026 to 2035 and support nearly 11,000 jobs nationwide. It is designated a strategic project under the EU Critical Raw Materials Act, reinforcing supply-chain security for Canada and its allies.

item.title: Indonesia Signals Peak in Nickel Mining Investment as Focus Shifts to Batteries, EVs
item.description: Indonesia's nickel mining boom has likely peaked, with the government shifting focus toward downstream battery production and electric vehicles. The rapid capital investment in upstream nickel extraction is slowing, emphasizing the utilization of processing capabilities developed in recent years. This marks a strategic pivot from raw nickel mining to value-added battery and EV industries.

item.title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, Italy, marking a step towards sustainable steel production. This initiative aligns with the company’s commitment to reducing carbon emissions and advancing renewable energy use in its manufacturing processes.

item.title: Domestic Aluminum Billet Inventory in Two Regions Rises to 77,500 mt on Dec 10, 2025: SMM
item.description: Inventory of aluminum billet in two domestic regions increased to 77,500 metric tons as of December 10, 2025. Despite this rise, ADC12 aluminum alloy prices are expected to continue fluctuating weakly in the short term due to supply-demand dynamics and cost factors.

item.title: Benteler expands its casthouse at Raufoss plant in Norway for more sustainable production
item.description: Benteler Group completed modernization of its casthouse in Norway, increasing recycled aluminum use from 30% to 40%, aiming for 50% by 2030. This upgrade is part of the 'BAR Green' project to reduce CO₂ emissions and enhance sustainable aluminum production.

item.title: Steel unit price index falls 0.1 to 3.2 % in Nov - DoSM
item.description: The unit price index of steel in Malaysia recorded a decrease ranging from 0.1 to 3.2 percent in November 2025 compared to the previous month, with the highest decreases in Miri and Kota Kinabalu. Year-on-year, the steel price index declined between 2.7 to 7.9 percent across most areas. Despite this, the cement price index increased in the same period.

item.title: Decision to discontinue domestic price assessments for steel rebar and billet in India
item.description: Fastmarkets has discontinued its price assessments for Indian domestic steel rebar and billet produced via the induction furnace route, as most quality long steel in India is now produced via the blast furnace route. This change took effect from December 10, 2025, following a consultation period. The discontinued prices included weekly assessments for rebar and billet in India.

item.title: Leading Indian companies collaborate with Sweden's innovators to drive decarbonisation in steel, cement sectors
item.description: Several leading Indian companies, including Tata Steel and Jindal Steel, are partnering with Swedish technology leaders and Indian academic institutions to launch seven projects focused on reducing greenhouse gas emissions in steel and cement industries. This collaboration supports India's net-zero carbon emissions goal by 2070 through pre-pilot feasibility assessments of emerging technologies.

item.title: Why 2026 could be copper's breakout year
item.description: Production guidance for the QB2 copper project shows output of 170,000-190,000 tonnes in 2025, increasing to 220,000-255,000 tonnes by 2028. This gradual capacity growth is part of broader expectations that 2026 could mark a breakout year for copper due to supply constraints and rising demand.

item.title: Copper Chemicals Market — Global Growth, Segmentation, Forecast Through 2032
item.description: The global copper chemicals market is expanding steadily, supported by increasing demand in various industrial applications. Growth projections extend through 2032, reflecting ongoing investments and capacity expansions in copper-related chemical production.

item.title: Fluor Awarded Engineering, Procurement and Integrated Construction Management Services Contract for Teck Resources Highland Valley Copper Mine Life Extension Project
item.description: Fluor has been awarded a contract to provide engineering, procurement, and construction management services for the Highland Valley Copper Mine life extension project in British Columbia. This project reflects ongoing investment in extending the operational capacity of one of Canada's key copper mines.

item.title: Nickel fell to 14,753 USD/T on December 10, 2025, down 0.15% from the previous day
item.description: Nickel prices decreased slightly to $14,753 per ton, continuing a downward trend over the past month with a 1.81% fall and a 6.81% decline year-over-year. The price is expected to trade around $14,909 by the end of the quarter and $14,119 in 12 months.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Flash] December 10 news: Nickel prices extended their decline
item.description: Nickel prices continued to decline on December 10 amid expectations around the US Federal Reserve's upcoming policy meeting. The market faces contradictions with firm upstream supply but weak demand.

item.title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
item.description: Prysmian views the U.S. copper tariff as an opportunity to strengthen the American supply chain. The company, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire, expects the tariff to benefit local players due to its domestic copper sourcing and vertical integration.
